item.title: Activision Is Cracking Down On Call Of Duty Camo Cheaters
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/activision-is-cracking-down-on-call-of-duty-camo-cheaters/1100-6530470/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty's Ricochet anti-cheat team is cracking down on those who have earned gun camos through ill-gotten means in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Call of Duty: Warzone, issuing temporary bans and even removing dishonorably obtained skins mid-match.

In a post from the official Call of Duty Updates X account, the Ricochet anti-cheat team made clear that using exploits or "unauthorized methods," such as external tools, violates the game's security and enforcement policy and will result in temporary bans.

RICOCHET anti-cheat's latest update has server side detection of players who use unlock tools to get camos.
It can now remove the unlock tool acquired camo from a weapon, mid-game. pic.twitter.com/MDf0DwlVwV

— CharlieIntel (@charlieINTEL) March 27, 2025

"Any attempt to unlock or equip camos through exploits or unauthorized methods will result in account enforcement," team Ricochet stated.

Ricochet, which is also the name of the anti-cheat tech in Call of Duty itself, appears to mean business. A post from Call of Duty news aggregator CharlieIntel shows the latest update to Ricochet can detect illegal weapon camos mid-match and remove them.

Team Ricochet further reminded players not to trust websites or offers selling COD points, cosmetic items, or leveling and progression services, as they violate the game's terms of service and can lead to a compromised game account. A number of Call of Duty cheat providers were recently reported to have shut down after receiving cease-and-desist letters from Activision.

The Ricochet updates and further action against cheaters comes ahead of Black Ops 6's Season 3 update and a major refresh for Call of Duty: Warzone that will see the free-to-play battle royale's original map, Verdansk, return. Black Ops 6 Season 3 will include a Jay and Silent Bob event, new weapons and maps, and more. Meanwhile, Call of Duty: Warzone will be offline and unplayable for 24 hours prior to the Verdansk update on April 3. Activision is giving away a free weapon in exchange for the downtime.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Preorders Are Live, Including A Premium Physical Edition
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/story-of-seasons-grand-bazaar-preorders-are-live-including-a-premium-physical-edition/1100-6530466/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Originally released for Nintendo DS in 2008, Nintendo is reviving Story of Season: Grand Bazaar for Switch and PC. The remake was revealed during the latest Nintendo Direct, and it's shaping up to be another relaxing outing for the farming/life simulator, thanks to reworked graphics, a new mode of transportation in the wind glider, and a cast of new characters and events. Preorders are now open ahead of its August 27 release.

Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Preorder Bonus

There are currently no preorder bonuses for Story of Seasons: Granda Bazaar. If anything changes (or any retailer-exclusives pop up), we'll be sure to update this section.

Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Standard Edition

$50 | Releases August 27

The standard edition of Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar is reasonably priced at $50. Whether you're a fan of the original or diving in for the first time, this is shaping up to be the best way to experience the farming action in 2025. Marvelous has already revealed a bunch of quality of life improvements coming to the Switch version, including improved graphics, an expanded story, a new glider for easier traversal, and full character voice work (which is a first for the series). Physical preorders of the Nintendo Switch version are available at Amazon and Best Buy. Digital preorders are also live on the Switch eShop and Steam.

Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition

$70 | Releases August 27

Upgrade to the Premium Edition to get a bunch of physical collectibles. Along with the base game, this includes:

  • Original soundtrack
  • 115+ page art book
  • Sheep pocket plush
  • Cloth poster
  • Outer storage box

The massive art book looks like an excellent way to dive deeper into the game's lore and development--though it's the adorable sheep pocket plush that might truly make this worth the extra $20. Consider giving it a look if you're a long-time fan.

Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma has a similar premium edition up for preorder, offering much of the same sort of content, including an art book and adorable plush. Consider preordering it ahead of its May 30 release, as it'd definitely look nice next to the Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition.

Story of Seasons is essentially the new name for Harvest Moon. When Marvelous decided to take over North American distribution responsibility from Natsume many years ago, the name had to be changed as Natsume still held the rights to the "Harvest Moon." So if you're an old fan of Harvest Moon trying to get back into its relaxing world, Story of Seasons is the name to look for.

A bunch of Harvest Moon and Story of Seasons games have launched over the past several years, and if you need something to bide time ahead of Grand Bazaar's release, here's a look at our favorites. We've also included a few Rune Factory games for good measure.

Story of Seasons, Harvest Moon, and Rune Factory Games

  • Harvest Moon: One World - Complete Edition -- $30
  • Harvest Moon: The Lost Valley and Skytree Village -- $40
  • Harvest Moon: The Winds of Anthos -- $20 ($50)
  • Story of Seasons: A Wonderful Life -- $25 ($30)
  • Story of Seasons: Friends of Mineral Town -- $31.40
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $50 | Releases August 27 | Also at Best Buy
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $70 | Releases August 27 | Also at Best Buy
  • Story of Seasons: Pioneers of Olive Town -- $30
  • Rune Factory 3 Special -- $28 ($30)
  • Rune Factory 4 -- $29.67
  • Rune Factory 5: Earthmate Edition -- $130
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $100 | Releases May 30
  • Amazon Sci-Fi And Fantasy Spring Book Sale - Save Big On Popular Box Sets
  • James Bond Sean Connery 4K Steelbook Collection Is Up For Preorder
  • Star Wars Skywalker Saga 4K Box Set Featured In Amazon's Spring Sale
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • 8BitDo Ultimate 2 Controller Gets Nice Discount A Month After Its Release
  • Best 4K Blu-Rays & Box Sets In Amazon's B2G1 Free Big Spring Sale
  • Lenovo Legion Go SteamOS Handheld Preorders Are Live At Best Buy
  • Zelda: Twilight Princess 11-Book Manga Box Set Is Nearly 50% Off At Amazon
  • Lego Transformers Optimus Prime Is Finally Back In Stock With A Big Discount
Jon Bitner on Google+

item.title: Honkai Star Rail Codes March 2025 For Free Stellar Jade, Credits, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/honkai-star-rail-codes-free-stellar-jade-credits/1100-6530457/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

HoYoverse's gacha RPG regularly receives working codes for freebies and rewards to help you on your travels. Some come from livestreams, or during events, whereas others may be obtained via social media. We've collected all of the Honkai Star Rail codes in one handy list, along with instructions on how to redeem them.

Active HSR codes

All of the new Honkai Star Rail codes are:

  • FIGHTWELLMYDEI - 3 Traveler’s Guide, 2 Golden Honeycakes
  • DBKMW7MA6XB3 - 50 Stellar Jade, 20,000 Credits
  • HSRCHOCO - 3 Traveler’s Guide, 3 Lost Lightdust, 3 Trick Snack
  • WHEREISTRIBBIE - 3 Traveler’s Guide, 1 Oronyx Slate
  • IFYOUAREREADINGTHIS - 60 Stellar Jade, 1 Fuel
  • 4TKSX77Y58QK - 30 Stellar Jade, 3 Traveler’s Guide, 5 Condensed Aether, 4 Lost Gold Fragment, 20,000 Credits
  • 5S6ZHRWTDNJB - 60 Stellar Jade
  • STARRAILGIFT - 50 Stellar Jade, 2 Traveler’s Guide, 5 Bottled Soda, 10,000 Credits

Honkai Star Rail livestream codes

The codes from the March 25 livestream for HSR are:

  • LT25JMU7F477 -100 Stellar Jade, 5 Traveler’s Guide
  • JS3MKMVNEL63 -100 Stellar Jade, 50,000 Credits

  • CA353MC6WMQB - 100 Stellar Jade, 4 Refined Aether

While there are regularly new HSR codes from the livestreams that detail each update, the most recent ones have currently expired.

How to redeem Honkai Star Rail codes

The HSR redeem code process is:

  • Open Honkai Star Rail
  • Press "Esc" to open the main menu
  • Open the options menu next to your username
  • Click "Redemption Code" from the drop-down options
  • Copy and paste one of the above codes
  • Press "Redeem"
  • Collect your freebies from your in-game mailbox
  • Enjoy!

You can also use the Honkai Star Rail website from HoYoverse to redeem your codes without needing to open the game.

To get more Honkai Star Rail codes, bookmark this page as we'll be updating it as soon as new ones are released. While you're waiting, fill up your rewards in other gacha games with our Genshin Impact codes for freebies.

Cheri Faulkner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Wuthering Waves Codes March 2025 For Free Astrite, Shell Credits, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wuthering-waves-codes-free-astrite-shell-credits/1100-6530458/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

With plentiful gacha games available for your enjoyment, it takes a strong one to retain player attention. Thankfully, Wuthering Waves is remaining strong after its release in 2024. As a thank you, Kuro Games has made many Wuthering Waves codes available for players to get free items. We've gathered all of them in one handy place, so you can keep this guide bookmarked and regularly check back for new active codes.

Active Wuthering Waves codes

All of the new Wuthering Waves codes are:

  • WHOAMI - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Enclosure Tanks, 20,000 Shell Credits (NEW!)
  • IMPERATOR - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Resonance Potions, 2 Medium Revival Inhalers (NEW!)
  • LEVIATHAN - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Energy Cores, 2 Medium Nutrient Blocks (NEW!)
  • SETSAIL - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Enclosure Tanks, 20,000 Shell Credits
  • VAULTOPS - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Energy Cores, 2 Medium Nutrient Blocks
  • TREASUREHUNT - 100 Astrite, 3 Advanced Resonance Potions, 2 Medium Revival Inhalers
  • WUTHERINGGIFT - 50 Astrite, 2 Medium Resonance Potions, 2 Medium Revival Inhalers, 2 Medium Energy Bags, 10,000 Shell Credits
  • WUWA4PC - 50 Astrite, 20,000 Shell Credits (PC only)

How to redeem Wuthering Waves codes

To redeem WuWa codes, follow these steps:

  • Reach Union Level 2
  • Open the in-game menu
  • Open the settings menu
  • Press "Other settings"
  • Press "Redemption Box"
  • Copy and paste a code from our list above
  • Press "Confirm"
  • Enjoy your rewards!

Unlike other gacha games, like Genshin Impact codes or Honkai Star Rail codes, there is no option to redeem Wuthering Waves codes on a browser website; it must be done in-game.

Cheri Faulkner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: How Call Of Duty Is Stepping Up Efforts To Fight Cheaters
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/how-call-of-duty-is-stepping-up-efforts-to-fight-cheaters/1100-6530471/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty's battle against cheaters continues, and ahead of Season 3's launch for Black Ops 6 and Warzone, Activision has released a blog detailing the new efforts to combat those unsavory players. Here are all the big changes announced for Call of Duty's Ricochet anti-cheat and the fight against hackers.

Activision confirmed the previous report that several Call of Duty cheat providers have been shut down. The publisher says that "over 20 cheat makers and dozens of cheat resellers" have been terminated since the launch of Black Ops 6, and that these shutdown efforts will continue.

"For the anti-cheat team, the focus remains on our commitment to taking down cheat makers, banning bad actors, and ensuring a great player experience," Activision says.

Call of Duty: Warzone - Unforgettable Verdansk Teaser Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

The publisher announced that the Ricochet team has issued over 228,000 bans since Black Ops 6 was released, citing that 23% of the cheaters were removed before they played their first match.

One of the new changes is the updated UI for Season 3. Activision says that a large portion of player-reported incidents are inaccurate and often console players. The report suggests that some of the inaccuracy might come from kills by players who used in-game intel like a Recon Scout perk or live ping. So, Season 3 will give players more detail on the KillCams to allow them to see if their opponent was using various game elements at the time of the kill.

Details in the KillCam widget will include:

  • List of attackers who dealt damage with their username, weapon, damage, and hits
  • Affected by Live Ping: If the enemy had you pinged via line-of-sight
  • Affected by UAV: If the enemy had you pinged on the minimap via UAV, UAV Tower, or
  • Advanced UAV
  • Affected by unsuppressed weapon: When firing your weapon revealed your location on
  • the minimap to nearby enemies

Season 3 will work to further improve the Ranked Play experience, which has previously been a hotspot for cheaters. The team will introduce a new system shortly after the launch of Season 3 that will help counter the impact a banned cheater had on the Ranked Play system with retroactive SR adjustments.

These actions include:

  • When a Ranked Play cheater is banned, anyone they've recently defeated in Ranked Play will receive a SR Refund for those matches (to start, we will examine the last two weeks of matches but will continue to monitor if this timing needs to be adjusted)
  • Players who we detect playing with cheaters may have SR for those wins taken away

A leaderboard scrub will also be performed before the end of Season 2 to remove any cheaters who gained SR illegitimately.

Additionally, Season 3 is bringing updates to the team's aimbot detections and the machine-learning system that analyzes game replays to identify suspicious gameplay for manual enforcement.

Changes are also coming to the account linking process in Season 3. Any account that links to a new platform may be required to complete a new security challenge to verify they are in control of the account. Failure to complete the challenge will block gameplay on that platform.

Activision also warned players against actions that could get them in trouble. This includes intentionally "teaming" to work with other squads to either grief other teams or account boost, as this is against the Call of Duty Code of Conduct and Security and Enforcement Policy. Activision recently warned players about account buying and selling, as any account that has been knowingly sold will be permanently banned.

Lastly, players can expect several new layers to Call of Duty's anti-cheat efforts with Season 3, but to avoid giving away all the details too early, Activision says it will release an updated report on these new anti-cheat efforts closer to the Season 3 Reloaded update.

The publisher has recently hyped up the return of Warzone's Verdansk map, such as releasing an OG Verdansk trailer and bringing back nostalgic weapons and operators. Hopefully, these new anti-cheat efforts will be enough to hold the cheaters back and not ruin all the nostalgic fun.

For more news, make sure to check out the highlights for Season 3 of Black Ops 6, which showcase the new Shattered Veil Zombies map, several multiplayer maps, and Jay and Silent Bob operator bundles. Warzone's Season 3 content is showcased here, including the classic features and vehicles returning with Verdansk.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: InZoi - Death, The Afterlife, And Ghosts Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/inzoi-death-the-afterlife-and-ghosts-explained/1100-6530456/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

What happens when you die in InZoi? It's a question that was somewhat explained by Krafton prior to the release of its life sim game. While there are up to 16 ways to die in InZoi, there are a limited number of options for what comes after death, including becoming a ghost and navigating the afterlife. Before you make your decision on whether to contend with the afterlife or simply reload an earlier save, we've got all you need to know on how it works.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • The afterlife
  • How to die in InZoi
    • Types of InZoi death

The afterlife

When your Zoi dies, you'll be given the option to go on to the afterlife or reload an earlier save. The latter is self-explanatory, but what exactly is the afterlife?

Depending on your Zoi's Karma score at the time of death, you may be able to pass on peacefully, or you may be forced to roam the city as a ghost until your Karma score improves. While Krafton hasn't fully implemented the ghost system at the early access release date, we do know how it works thanks to the in-game tooltips that appear.

If you've been living a life of crime, maybe you decided to rob an ATM or two, maybe you interacted negatively with other Zois, or maybe you've been forced to get out of jail more than once, then your Karma score won't be good. If this is the case, when you turn into a ghost you'll need to commit good deeds to raise your Karma score to "good" in order to peacefully pass on.

If there are too many ghosts in your city, you will find that it's difficult to create other Zois to move in. Other citizens will also be creeped out because, well, you're a ghost. While the ghost system isn't yet active in-game, it's unclear which good deeds will raise your Karma as a ghost. We're hoping there will be actions exclusive to ghosts, but that hasn't been confirmed yet. Ghosts are due to be added to the game around August 2025.

You'll also be given the option to go back in time. This way, you can save your Zoi from death before it's too late.

How to die in InZoi

In our case, we were deliberately trying to murder our Zoi by starving him to death, just to see how this system works. It took three full in-game days of no food and approximately six "12 hours left" warnings before he finally passed away, so if your Zoi does die, it seems like you'll have gone well out of your way to make it happen depending on the manner of their dying. It's difficult to kill off a Zoi, at least through starvation or exhaustion, though it's a bit easier to be electrocuted while you try to rob an ATM in InZoi.

Types of InZoi death

While the developer says there are plentiful ways to die, including car accidents, even when running headfirst into traffic we didn't suffer so much as a scratch. Here are all of the ways we've discovered to die in InZoi so far:

  • Starvation - Not eating for an extended period of time
  • Exhaustion - Not sleeping for an extended period of time
  • Pollution - Repeated exposure to high levels of pollution for a long time
  • Disease - If a Zoi gets a disease and remains untreated
  • Car Accident - When in a vehicle and experiencing a high-speed collision with another car
  • Loneliness - No social interaction or recognition
  • Slipping - Wet surfaces are a hazard
  • Electric Shock - Breaking into an ATM or repairing broken electronics can result in electrocution
  • Burning - Sims fans will be familiar with their characters dying in a fire
  • Embarrassment - While we haven't seen this ourselves yet, Krafton has mentioned Zois can actually die of embarrassment.
  • Old Age - The natural way

Krafton has stated it will not add murder to the game, as it doesn't agree with it. However, it has said that if one Zoi accidentally starts a fire, and another Zoi is near that fire, they're likely to pass away. Make of that what you will.

Cheri Faulkner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
